name: peripatetically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves travelling around to different places, usually because you work in more than one place: He remembers a childhood where his peripatetically employed parents struggled to pay the bills. The company moved peripatetically between theatres, with no regular base.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was educated peripatetically in South Africa, Canada, and Oxford. Mariana imagines him as peripatetically travelling the globe. The novel follows an American in Mexico who peripatetically moves from cotton picking to working in the oil fields, to herding cattle.
